intro: Gnaphalium sedoides, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Gnaphalium sedoides is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
